From the manufacturer

SafeRest mattress protectors are well known for their premium protection against dust mites, fluids, urine, perspiration, and allergens. This has made them especially helpful for those with kids, pets, allergies, asthma or incontinence. With just one unprotected fluid accident, a mattress can be left with a permanent stain or odor. SafeRest premium mattress protectors safeguard your mattress against fluids and stains offering peace of mind and a more sterile sleeping environment for you and your family.

Dust mites are a constant problem for millions of Americans who suffer from daily allergy and asthma triggers. SafeRest mattress protectors prevent dust mites from passing through the surface of the protector where they would normally multiply and defecate. By reducing dust mite exposure to the mattress, the sleeper can better control their sleep environment resulting in a reduction in allergy triggers and overall better air quality. Periodically wash the mattress protector with your sheets to remove dust mites and other allergens resting on the surface of the protector. We suggest quarterly launderings for best results.

Hypoallergenic Soft Cotton Terry Surface - Cool, Breathable and Noiseless

SafeRest uses only the finest high quality components for their protectors to ensure your sleep experience will be just as quiet and comfortable as before it was applied.

SafeRest's premium cotton terry surface design is soft, smooth, and noiseless. Cotton terry naturally absorbs fluids while allowing air and heat to pass through, keeping your bed cool and dry.

SafeRest Invisa-Shield Fitted Sheet Style

The surface of our fitted sheet style protector is designed not to interfere with the current feel of your mattress. No matter if your mattress is a firm or pillow top, it will still have the same feel after our protector is applied.

Our mattress protectors are also designed for all types of mattresses including memory foam, latex and innerspring. For best results, wash the protector first. This opens up the cotton terry loops as the protector arrives tightly folded to reduce packaging.

Vinyl, Phthalates and PVC Free Waterproof Breathable Membrane

Protect your mattress from fluid spills like sweat and urine with SafeRest's exclusive membrane layer. This unique design blocks fluids from reaching the mattress while still allowing the mattress to breathe preventing heat buildup.

SafeRest's waterproof membrane is free of vinyl, PVC, phthalates or fire retardant treatments. It's perfect for those with children, allergies or asthma.

Easy Cleaning. ..Machine Washable

Washing:

Machine-wash the mattress protector with your sheets using normal household detergents that do not contain bleach.

Drying:

Tumble dry on low heat together with bed sheets, towels or other clothing.

Do not iron and do not dry clean.

Product Description

SafeRest Premium Mattress Protectors Provide Undetectable Protection for You and Your Family

Protects against perspiration, urine and fluids
SafeRest Premium Mattress Protectors offer protection against fluids, urine, perspiration and making them especially helpful for those with kids, pets or incontinence. As we sleep we shed thousands of dead skin cells, which can quickly accumulate providing an ideal environment. SafeRest mattress protectors trap and skin cells on the surface of the protector where they can be easily washed away during suggested quarterly launderings. This helps provide a cleaner environment for you and your family.

Soft Cotton Terry Surface - Breathable, Cool and Noiseless
To keep our protectors cool and noiseless, the surface material is made with soft cotton terry back coated with a breathable and 100% waterproof membrane layer. Cotton terry naturally absorbs moisture and is completely noiseless.

Fitted Sheet Style
To ensure a great fit, an elastic band is used on the side skirt to automatically pull excess material under the mattress.

Machine Washable
Machine-wash with your sheets using normal household detergents that do not contain bleach. Tumble dry on low heat. Do not iron.

SafeRest Invisa-Shield™
Our mattress protectors will not change the feel of your mattress. This is great for those with any type of mattress including innerspring, latex or memory foam.

How customer reviews and ratings work

Customer Reviews, including Product Star Ratings help customers to learn more about the product and decide whether it is the right product for them.

To calculate the overall star rating and percentage breakdown by star, we don’t use a simple average. Instead, our system considers things like how recent a review is and if the reviewer bought the item on Amazon. It also analyzed reviews to verify trustworthiness.

Learn more how customers reviews work on Amazon

Amazon Customer
5 Stars
Will save your mattress from pet pee
6/27/2016*Update*I woke up this morning to a puddle of fresh cat pee on the bed. Thankfully this protector was on the mattress so all I had to do was soak up the spot with Nature's Miracle and throw the sheets and this in the wash. NO mess. Drying does take longer because you have to use low heat, but overall this is waterproof and kept my mattress free of cat pee this morning.Just thought I'd share.Here's some advice I am going to share that will hopefully help you save your mattress. My trial and error.I have 4 cats (1 female, 3 neutered males). 3 of my cats I raised as kittens and other was an adult high kill shelter rescue- so 2 of my male cats were not neutered and sprayed. Cat Lady
5.0 out of 5 stars Will save your mattress from pet pee
Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2016
Material Type: Original (Cotton Terry)Size: QueenVerified Purchase
6/27/2016

*Update*

I woke up this morning to a puddle of fresh cat pee on the bed. Thankfully this protector was on the mattress so all I had to do was soak up the spot with Nature's Miracle and throw the sheets and this in the wash. NO mess. Drying does take longer because you have to use low heat, but overall this is waterproof and kept my mattress free of cat pee this morning.
Just thought I'd share.

Here's some advice I am going to share that will hopefully help you save your mattress. My trial and error.

I have 4 cats (1 female, 3 neutered males). 3 of my cats I raised as kittens and other was an adult high kill shelter rescue- so 2 of my male cats were not neutered and sprayed. Now after lots of trial and error I have found solutions that work and am sharing them with you so hopefully you won't go through all the frustrations I did trying to clean the house of that awful cat spray stench and cat pee smell.

One of the favorite places for my male cats to pee and spray was/is the bed. I am not sure why, but I've read something about cats wanting to mingle their smell with yours, especially if they have separation anxiety when you're gone during the day.
Anyone who has tried getting cat spray smell out of a mattress will tell you that it is nearly impossible and many probably have thrown out the mattress because the smell is so hard to remove. If you don't get a mattress protector like this one on the mattress in time and a cat pees or sprays on it, you will need to find a way to clean up the pee smell (both to your senses and the cats senses) or else the cat will continue to back to that same place to pee/spray again.

Here is my solution that might help save a mattress.
When my cats sprayed the bed and this all stopped after they were neutered, except one cat is 'high strung' and the vet thinks he has anxiety issues- which means that when he gets mad at me he seeks out the bed or pillows to pee on (and no sometimes he doesn't care if I am sleeping in the bed, he will go about his business as if I wasn't even there).
The trick is to treat the pee area (once you find it) because honestly that smell is awful, who wants to sleep in a bed that smells like a skunk marinated it's stink all over your mattress? (that is what cat spray smells like, in my opinion).
Natures Miracle just for Cats- urine smell and stain remover works wonders to treat the pee/spray spot FIRST. Follow instructions there on the bottle but to treat a mattress of memory foam topper I pour a cup full of NM onto the pee spot and let it soak. Blot after an hour. Smell to see if the horrendous odor is still there and pour on another cup if it is. IF the smell is gone and all you can smell is NM, then blot and let it air out till dry before putting sheets and a water proof mattress protector back on.
You can find Natures Miracle here > and I do suggest buying a gallon bottle if you have a cat with any issues peeing or spraying.
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002I3ANQ8/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o04_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

Now for this waterproof mattress protector- I love it. It has saved me lots of time and cleaning when my cat decides to pee on the bed. Now all I do is wipe the spot down with some Natures Miracle, wash the pad in the washer and done. No more soaking and struggling to get the pee smell gone from my mattress. I do love how this pad keeps the pee from going through to the mattress even if I don't catch it till it's dry.

To those who are new like I was to waterproof vs water resistant- waterproof is when liquid doesn't go through material and eventually dries there. Water resistant is when the liquid will go through the material if you don't pick it up IMMEDIATELY and it will go through to your mattress and dry there if not picked up right away.
I would much rather have water proof because I can't always find where the cat peed on time and when I do find it, the spot is already dried- the stink is stronger dry.

Overall I am very happy with this mattress protector because it is not crinkly, makes no noise when we sleep on it and stays put on the bed without us and it sliding around all night long. This launders easily with the sheets and when my cat does get mad enough at me to pee on the bed, like I said, it's so much easier cleaning pee of THIS than it is the mattress or memory foam.
I'd highly recommend to everyone who has pets or kids. My 18 mo old occasionally leaks through his diaper at night, so I ordered a second one just for his crib and couldn't be happier with that.

Hopefully this has helped save someone else's bed. I wish when my cat first started spraying that someone had written a blog or review like this one tying the 2 things together- mattress protector/Natures Miracle cat pee odor remover because honestly, who has time to be scrubbing pee off a mattress anyways?

In my attached picture you can see a puddle of water I made at the kitchen sink. The water stayed right there until I of course spilled it all over myself. I am happy to say the water does not go through, not even a drop.
